books.title: A Quick and Dirty Guide to Art, Music, and Culture
books.author: Clayton Funk
books.description: A guide for artist and musician biographies. We discuss art and music in the context of popular culture, so you will see relationships between art and music and what you are learning and the way you live, to connect them to your own experience.

books.title: How to Study Art Worlds: On the Societal Functioning of Aesthetic Values
books.author: Hans van Maanen
books.description: This study brings together the organisational side of the world of arts and the understanding of the many functions art fulfills in our culture. The author establishes how the organisation of art worlds serves the functioning of the arts in society.

books.title: Masterpieces of The Metropolitan Museum of Art
books.author: Barbara Burn
books.description: Housing one of the finest collections in the world, The Metropolitan Museum of Art is a living encyclopedia of art. Insightful text opens each section and provides historical background, while in-depth commentary accompanies each featured work.

books.title: Anatomy Live: Performance and the Operating Theatre
books.author: Maaike Bleeker
books.description: Anatomy Live turns our modern notions of the dissecting table on its head -using anatomical theatre as a means of obtaining a fresh perspective on representations of the body, conceptions of subjectivity and own knowledge about science and the stage.

books.title: Acting Emotions
books.author: Elly Konijn
books.description: The book's survey of the various dominant acting styles is followed by an analysis of the current state of affairs regarding the psychology of emotions. The author concludes that traditional acting theories are no longer valid for today's actor.

books.title: Dance: A Very Social History
books.author: Carol McD. Wallace, et al.
books.description: The authors of this book take readers into the world of dance and performing. The book surveys the history of dance, examines the development of ball gowns and other dancing costumes, and discusses the depiction of dance in art.

books.title: Art Principles
books.author: Ernest Govett
books.description: Contents: Classification of the Fine Arts; Law of Recognition in the Associated Arts; Law of General Assent; Limitations of the Associated Arts; Degrees of Beauty in the Painter's Art; Expression; Landscape; Still-life; Secondary Art; Colour; etc.

books.title: Art on the Edge: 17 Contemporary American Artists
books.author: Steven Henry Madoff
books.description: This publication showcases the work of 17 contemporary American artists. As a group, these up-and-comers exemplify such bedrock American values as innovation, diversity, freedom, individualism, and competitive excellence.

books.title: Human Anatomy for Art Students
books.author: Alfred Downing Fripp, Ralph Thompson
books.description: Concise guide to rendering the human body in art. Illustrations and cross-sections give readers examples of human skeletal and muscular substructures and details of individual body parts, to enable precise visual recreation of human form and motion.

books.title: Digital Creativity
books.author: Antonio Pizzo
books.description: This paper presents one of the task of project Invisibilia Project and confirms that the term ''digital creativity'' represents a disperse notion in which a number of different definition developed along last decades are merged.

books.title: Darkest Peru
books.author: Robert Cooke
books.description: A struggling actor embarks on an unwise adventure into the Peruvian wilderness. His need to escape 'real life' sees him negotiating the towering Andes and sprawling Amazon basin, fending for himself in a land growing more dangerous by the minute.

books.title: Dictionary of World Biography
books.author: Barry Jones
books.description: Mahatma Ghandi to Madonna, Jesus Christ to Jimmy Carter from a Non-American and Non-European veiwpoint. Jones is an Australian politician, writer and lawyer, educated at Melbourne University, the first to raise public awareness of global warming ...

books.title: Fame in the 20th Century
books.author: Clive James
books.description: This book traces how the development of mass communications - press, radio, film and television - has transformed the nature of fame, and how the famous have dealt with that fame. The key international figures of the 20th century are examined.

books.title: A Gallery of Eccentrics
books.author: Morris Bishop
books.description: Odd ducks, Limited! That is what this book is about. Twelve biographies of people who are different from the rest of us. Different, does not mean evil or overly kinky. There are two sides to 'Normal': The abnormally good and the abnormally bad.

books.title: Benevolence : From Guatemala to Goa On a Zimmer Frame
books.author: Jim West
books.description: At the age of one I contracted Polio. Suddenly, a world of infinite possibilities collapsed in upon me. Everything was now a struggle: breathing, lifting my arms, learning to walk. Nothing came easily. And the suffering wasn't just physical.

books.title: Ten Days in a Mad-House
books.author: Nellie Bly
books.description: The book comprised Nellie Bly's reportage for the New York World in 1887 while on an undercover assignment in which she feigned insanity to investigate reports of brutality and neglect at the Women's Lunatic Asylum on Blackwell's Island.

books.title: Life of Beethoven
books.author: Anton Schindler
books.description: The life of Beethoven, including his correspondence with his friends, numerous characteristic traits, and remarks on his musical works. The work was first published in 1840 and had a great deal of influence on later Beethoven biography.

books.title: Diary of a Suicide
books.author: Wallace E. Baker
books.description: The body of a well-dressed young man was found off Manhattan Beach, Sept. 28th. In his pockets a torn photograph of Strindberg and receipts for three registered letters were found. These receipts were traced to Mr. Herts and to friends in Toronto.

books.title: Representative Men
books.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
books.description: Representative Men includes seven lectures on great men -- Plato, Swedenborg, Montaige, Shakespeare, Napoleon, and Goethe. If the companions of our childhood should turn out to be heroes, and their condition regal, it would not surprise us.

books.title: Antonio Stradivari
books.author: Horace William Petherick
books.description: This is a biographical sketch of the great Cremonese master, expressed in a manner interesting and instructive as possible. The author abstained from using technical terms not readily comprehended by a reader coming newly to the subject.

books.title: Michelangelo
books.author: Romain Rolland
books.description: The life of Michelangelo offers a striking example of the influence that a great man can have on his time. Michelangelo burst like a thunder-storm into the heavy, overcharged sky of Florence. He captured painting, sculpture, architecture and poetry.

books.title: The Life of Sir Richard Burton
books.author: Thomas Wright
books.description: Sir Richard Burton was an English explorer, writer, soldier, ethnologist, poet and diplomat. He was known for his travels and explorations within Asia and Africa as well as his extraordinary knowledge of languages and cultures.

books.title: God's Gold: The Story of Rockefeller and His Times
books.author: John T. Flynn
books.description: The classic and extraordinary full biography of John D. Rockefeller. Flynn shows how Rockefeller employed the tools of capitalism to become enormously rich, and how this unleashed the most unexpected backlash from anti-capitalists of all sorts.

books.title: Men of Wealth
books.author: John T. Flynn
books.description: First-class business history, the story of great fortunes made by the most notable men of wealth in history: Jacob Fugger, John Law, Nathan Rothschild, Thomas Gresham, Robert Owen, Cornelius Vanderbilt, J.P. Morgan and J.D. Rockefeller.

books.title: Fundamentals of Business
books.author: Stephen J. Skripak
books.description: Contents: Foundations of Business; Economics and Business; Ethics and Social Responsibility; Business in a Global Environment; Forms of Business Ownership; Entrepreneurship; Management and Leadership; Structuring Organizations; Operations Management.

books.title: A New Deal for Social Security
books.author: Peter J. Ferrara, Michael D. Tanner
books.description: How to reform Social Security and end the looming crisis. As the debate over Social Security's future heats up, this book will be vital reading for anyone interested in ensuring that future generations enjoy dignified, secure retirement.

books.title: Financial Mathematics
books.author: C.H. Richardson, I.L. Miller
books.description: This text is designed for a course for students who desire a knowledge of the mathematics of modern business and finance. The vocational aspects of the subject should be especially attractive to students of commerce and business administration.

books.title: The Sustainable Business Case Book
books.author: Ross Gittell, Matt Magnusson, Michael Merenda
books.description: This book combines the theory of sustainability with key concepts, analytical and contextual information with a collection of cases which provide guidance on how sustainable businesses operate from different business functional area perspectives.

books.title: Consequences of the Global Financial Crisis
books.author: Wyn Grant, Graham K. Wilson
books.description: The Global Financial Crisis is the most serious economic crisis since the Great Depression. Many books have explored its causes, but this book systematically explores its consequences. The focus is on the policy and political consequences of the GFC.

books.title: Developing New Products and Services
books.author: G. Lawrence Sanders
books.description: The book focuses on the upfront activities and ideas for new product and service development. A number of powerful concepts and tools are presented so your students can better understand how to facilitate new product development.

books.title: The Sustainable Business
books.author: Jonathan T. Scott
books.description: Recommended for managers, employees, teachers, and students, this informative guide explains the importance of waste minimisation as a first step toward sustainability. The breadth and depth of long-term, profitable business practices are explored.

books.title: Business Mathematics: A Textbook
books.author: Edward I. Edgerton, Wallace E. Bartholomew
books.description: The course in this book is much more advanced than the usual course in commercial arithmetic. The attempt has been made to construct a practical course which will contain all the essential mathematical knowledge required in a business career.

books.title: Introductory Business Statistics
books.author: Thomas K. Tiemann
books.description: The book explores the basic ideas behind statistics, such as populations, samples, the data and information, and most importantly sampling distributions. Using real-world examples, the author hopes to help students understand how statistics works.

books.title: Cognitive Patterns: Problem-Solving Frameworks for Object Technology
books.author: Karen M Gardner, et al.
books.description: This book presents concepts and terminology of cognitive patterns and cognitive modeling. It explains the uniqueness of cognitive patterns as an approach in modeling business systems and processes. It models the way reality is understood by people.

books.title: Home Buying Guide
books.author: Eric Proulx
books.description: Buying a home should be an exciting experience. For so many, however, the process is confusing, filled with jargon and legalese. This guide is your answer to all of that: a concise guide on the home buying process, from start to finish.

books.title: Business Fundamentals
books.author: Donald J McCubbrey
books.description: The book is designed to introduce students to the essential concepts of business and other organizations. It focuses on small, entrepreneurial start-ups, and expands the discussion to include issues that are faced in larger organizations.

books.title: Business Psychology
books.author: Christian D. Larson
books.description: The majority among practical business men prefer a brief and condensed presentation of the best methods that have been evolved through experiments with business psychology. And it is this preference that has been considered in every chapter.

books.title: Business Ethics
books.author: William Frey
books.description: Designed as a laboratory, skills-based book where students develop, practice, and refine decision-making and problem-solving strategies that they will carry with them into the world of business practice. The approach is decidedly practical.

books.title: Exploring Business
books.author: Karen Collins
books.description: The author's goals in writing Exploring Business were simple: first, introduce students to business in an exciting way and second, provide faculty with a fully developed teaching package that allows them to do the former.

books.title: Statistics for Business and Economics
books.author: Marcelo Fernandes
books.description: In today's economic environment it is practically impossible to avoid dealing with data gathering and analysis. This free textbook provides a comprehensive overview of the main topics in the area of statistic analysis for business and economics.

books.title: The Federal Mafia
books.author: Irwin Schiff
books.description: The Federal Mafia exposes every facet of the government's illegal enforcement  of the income tax - and will convince you that Organized Crime in America begins with The Federal Government. The government doesn't want you to know what's in this book.

books.title: Cat Coloring Pages
books.author: Marko Petkovic
books.description: Printable coloring book for kids with twenty-six adorable cat drawings. Coloring pages are a great way for kids to awaken their creativity. The joy of coloring in the whole page and bringing life to simple cat drawings are real achievements for kids.

books.title: What If Dogs Ran the World?
books.author: Uncle Henry
books.description: Everyone knows that dogs are man's best friend. Just imagine how much better the whole world might be, if we just let dogs run everything instead of politicians. Naturally, there would be a few operational changes and some minor adjustments.

books.title: What You Don't Want To Be When You Grow Up
books.author: Uncle Henry
books.description: No one ever tells you about the not-so-swell jobs out there you definitely want to avoid if at all possible. Here, just so you can learn what not to do with your life before it's too late, is a complete list of the 13 worst jobs of all time.

books.title: 21 Easter Activities for Kids
books.author: Teresa Evans
books.description: Fun and educational Easter activities that parents and teachers can use with children in the lead up to Easter. Keep the kids busy and happy with these favorite activities including Easter crafts, Easter cooking, Easter games and Easter puzzles.

books.title: Hero of the Mountain
books.author: Ivan Parvov
books.description: The little fox Lulu was very excited. The big contest 'Hero of the mountain' will take place tomorrow. The little fox Lulu want to see it at any cost. But is this so easy? Join the little fox Lulu in his incredible adventure...

books.title: Snake Wrangling for Kids
books.author: Jason R Briggs
books.description: Snake Wrangling for Kids is a printable electronic book, for children 8 years and older, who would like to learn computer programming. It covers the very basics of programming, and uses the Python 3 programming language to teach the concepts.

books.title: Wikijunior: Languages
books.author: Robert Horning, at al.
books.description: A basic introduction for 8-12 years old kids to learn about different languages around the world. The text covers a large variety of languages rather than studying any particular language in depth. The goal is to provide some basic language skills.

books.title: Christmas Roses
books.author: Lizzie Lawson, Robert Ellice Mack
books.description: Illustrated book with poems: Christmas Roses, The Christmas Stocking, The Pet Rabbit, Father's Boat, A Mistake, A Sad Tale, Hie for Christmas, Puss in the Corner, Little Bo-peep, The Story Book Fairy, Spring, Golden Days, Nearly Bedtime.

books.title: The Book of Art for Young People
books.author: Agnes Ethel Conway, Sir Martin Conway
books.description: This is an illustrated book of Fine Art for children. It is full of works of famous painters: the Van Eycks, Sandro Botticelli, Raphael, Giorgione, Tintoret, Holbein, Rembrandt, Van Dyck, Velasquez, Reynolds, Turner, etc.

books.title: All About Books
books.author: Otto Jasper Christenson
books.description: Otto Jasper Christenson, the author and illustrator of this book, successfully answers the questions about books that any reader have had at one time or another: What are they for? What are they made of? Why should you read them at all?

books.title: Comic History of the United States
books.author: Livingston Hopkins
books.description: The author hired a vacant lot on Nassau street, and there, surrounded by the paraphernalia of literature and art, he went to work with pen and pencil to jot down the leading incidents of American history to the best of a somewhat defective memory.

books.title: Good and Evil
books.author: Michael Pearl, Danny Bulanadi
books.description: The Ultimate Superhero Graphic Novel. In the beginning... Before the first man was created, before the earth, the sun, the stars, even before light and time were created, there was God. He alone existed without beginning, but he was not alone...

books.title: Bound By Law: Tales from the Public Domain
books.author: J. Boyle, J. Jenkins, K. Aoki
books.description: This graphic novel is an excellent introduction to copyright law. The authors wanted to make copyright accessible for everyone. The 'plot' revolves around Akiko, a filmmaker who wants to capture a day in the life of New York City ...

books.title: English Caricaturists
books.author: Graham Everitt
books.description: An entertaining history of caricature, and consequently of the events, political and social, of the nineteenth century. The book gives an elaborate estimate of the merits of the later caricaturists and a complete account of their lives.

books.title: The art of caricaturing
books.author: Mitchell Smith
books.description: In this brief and consistent book Mitchell Smith gives lessons that cover all branches of caricaturing. Drawings illustrate all necessary points, and each point is explained in the text. Author included caricatures of many famous men.

books.title: Ostrich Cycles
books.author: Carl Antonowicz
books.description: This is a comic book based on a dream. 'The world is very sick, grandpa says. He says they're all walking somewhere they think is important. He says they've got everything all mixed up. We're the only ones who can help them, grandpa says.

books.title: Computer Desktop Encyclopedia
books.author: Alan Freedman
books.description: This desktop encyclopedia contains more than 10,000 terms, which are explained accurately and lucidly. The expansive, 'encyclopedic' format of the book makes it possible to explain concepts and historical background at whatever length is necessary.

books.title: Advances and Applications in Mobile Computing
books.author: Adem Karahoca
books.description: The book aims to enhance mobile software application development stages: analysis, design, development and test. Also, recent mobile network technologies, such as algorithms and decreasing energy consumption in mobile network, are covered.

books.title: A History of the Personal Computer
books.author: Roy A. Allan
books.description: A history of the personal computer revolution. Early personal computing, the 'first' personal computer, invention of the microprocessor and the first microcomputer are detailed. It also traces the evolution from the software hacker to the Internet.

books.title: An Introduction to Computing
books.author: Subhashis Banerjee, S. Arun Kumar
books.description: The text intended for first year students with some prior elementary background in programming. It covers problem formulation, the design of an algorithm, and the design of a program from an algorithm through a process of step-wise refinement.

books.title: Content: Selected Essays on Technology, Creativity, Copyright, and the Future of the Future
books.author: Cory Doctorow
books.description: Discover how America chose Happy Meal toys over copyright, why Facebook is taking a faceplant, how the Internet is just a giant Xerox machine, why Wikipedia is a poor cousin of The Hitchhikers Guide to the Galaxy, and how to enjoy free e-books.

books.title: A College Student's Guide to Computers in Education
books.author: David Moursund
books.description: The book for students in colleges and universities, but also useful to high school studetns who are thinking about going to college. The information presented will help you to obtain an education that will be useful to you throughout your life.

books.title: Troubleshooting Methodology for Homebrew
books.author: Jason Johnson
books.description: This is a short book intended for the novice to intermediate brewer or anyone interested in learning the basics of evaluating a beer. This book will help define many common beer flavors and aromas and their descriptions, both the good and the bad.

books.title: Brewing
books.author: Will Wesley, et al.
books.description: This book aims to help you become a well rounded and versed master home brewer. You can use this book as part of a class led by an experienced instructor, however, determined students will certainly be able to use this material on their own.

books.title: Good Wine: The New Basics
books.author: Richard Paul Hinkle
books.description: Richard Hinkle shares his knowledge of the different varieties from aperitif to dessert wines and every red and white in between. You'll find all the key answers to your questions on tasting, creating a cellar and, more importantly, how to stock it.

books.title: Starting Your Own Wine Business
books.author: W. C. Morris
books.description: You have been making wine in your basement for several years and routinely receive accolades on how good your homemade wine tastes. Now you are trying to decide if you should start your own vineyard and build a commercial winery.

books.title: Six Arguments for a Greener Diet
books.author: Michael F. Jacobson
books.description: Examination of scientific studies finds that eating more plant foods and fewer fatty animal products can lead to extra years of healthy living. This book is a description of the links between our diet and serious environmental and health problems.

books.title: The A B C of Mining
books.author: Charles A. Bramble
books.description: A Handbook for Prospectors, Treating fully of Exploratory and Preparatory Work of the Physical Properties of Ores, Field Geology, the Occurrence and Associations of Minerals, Methods of Chemical Analysis and Assay, Blow-pipe Tests, ...

books.title: Innovations and New Technologies
books.author: Alexander Bolonkin
books.description: Author summarizes some of the revolutionary macro-projects, concepts, ideas, innovations, and methods for scientists, engineers, technical students, and the world public. The book gives the main physical data and technical equations in attachments.

books.title: The Nuclear Energy Option: An Alternative for the 90's
books.author: Bernard L. Cohen
books.description: Cohen provides scientifically sound risk analyses of the energy options that he believes must be exercised in the next 10 years. This work stands opposed to some recent greenhouse effect-oriented titles by proposing more nuclear power plants.

books.title: Introductory Well Testing
books.author: Tom Aage Jelmert
books.description: The objective is to provide an easy to read introduction to classical well test theory. No previous knowledge in well testing is required. The reader is expected to understand basic concepts of flow in porous media. Some calculus skill is required.

books.title: Engineering Management
books.author: F.P.G. Maarquez, Benjamin Lev (eds)
books.description: The book synthesises the engineering principles with business practice, i.e. the book provides an interface between the main disciplines of engineering/technology and the organizational, administrative, and planning abilities of management.

books.title: The New Engineering
books.author: Eugene F. Adiuroti
books.description: The New Engineering presents an engineering science that is conceptually and mathematically much simpler than conventional engineering. The simplicity results from abandoning contrived parameters such as resistances and coefficients and moduluses.

books.title: Concurrent Engineering
books.author: Peter Burke, et al.
books.description: Concurrent engineering is a process in which appropriate disciplines are committed to work interactively to conceive, develop, and implement product programs that meet pre-determined objectives. This book is geared toward entry-level engineers.

books.title: Applications and Experiences of Quality Control
books.author: Ognyan Ivanov
books.description: The rich palette of topics set out in this book provides a broad overview of the developments in the field of quality control. This book can serve as a basis for starting interdisciplinary cooperation, which is an integral part of research.

books.title: The Age of Invention: A Chronicle of Mechanical Conquest
books.author: Holland Thompson
books.description: This volume is a record of inventive genius and mechanical progress in the United States. All this book seeks to do is to outline the personalities of some of the outstanding American inventors and indicate the significance of their achievements.

books.title: An Introduction to Energy Sources
books.author: B Viswanathan
books.description: The reasons for the choice of energy sources are many. There is a need to know the options available, the need to harness some of these sources efficiently and effectively and above all the environmental concerns these energy sources give rise to.

books.title: A Pictorial History of Radio
books.author: Irving Settel
books.description: They are all here, the hundreds of personalities and programs that have brightened the airwaves during radio's fifty-year history. The focus is on radio's glamorous days -- the bittersweet depression years and the grim days of World War II.

books.title: The Funniest Five Thousand Jokes, part 1
books.author: Eric Landa
books.description: This first book contains five thousand jokes from a variety of sources from both famous and ordinary people. Hopefully they'll bring a smile to your face, a grin to your mouth and maybe make your fingers scratch your head every now and then ...

books.title: A History of Dancing
books.author: R. St.-Johnston
books.description: Contents: The Muse of Dancing in Ancient Mythology; Dancing as a Religious Ceremony; Allegorical Dances; Quaint Dances in Civilized Countries; The Ballet; Stage Dancing of today; Dancing as a Social Pastime; A Short History of the World's Dancers.

books.title: Memory: How to Develop, Train, and Use It
books.author: William Walker Atkinson
books.description: This book is a great insight on the workings of the human mind and how powerful it can be. It just goes to show that with a little bit of training we can improve our memory and help to recall some important data, that otherwise might be lost.

books.title: The Power of Concentration
books.author: Theron Q. Dumont
books.description: It is of the utmost value to learn how to concentrate. To make success of anything you must be able to concentrate your entire thought upon the idea you are working on. The greatest man would accomplish nothing if he lacked concentration.

books.title: Smart Health Choices
books.author: L. Irwig, J. Irwig, L. Trevena, M. Sweet
books.description: This book aims to help consumers and practitioners develop the skills to assess health advice -- and hopefully to make decisions that will improve the quality of their care. For some people, making better-informed decisions could be life saving.

books.title: Bounce: Be Transformed
books.author: Lana Ribble Staheli
books.description: Lana Ribble Staheli has pulled together her experience to create Bounce, a simple but profound program to add joy and fulfillment to our lives. Her voice shines through this book and encourages us to be the best person we can be.

books.title: Teaching History in the Digital Age
books.author: T. Mills Kelly
books.description: T. Mills Kelly synthesizes more than two decades of research in digital history, offering practical advice on how to make best use of the results of this synthesis in the classroom and new ways of thinking about pedagogy in the digital humanities.

books.title: History of Concepts: Comparative Perspectives
books.author: Iain Hampsher-Monk (ed.)
books.description: Contributions by distinguished practitioners of conceptual history from Europe and America illustrate both the distinctiveness and diversity of the genre. The book is devoted to the origins and identity of the field, as well as methodological issues.

books.title: The History Manifesto
books.author: Jo Guldi, David Armitage
books.description: How should historians speak truth to power? Why is five hundred years better than five years as a planning horizon? The History Manifesto is a call to arms to historians and everyone interested in the role of history in contemporary society.

books.title: Pastplay: Teaching and Learning History with Technology
books.author: Kevin Kee
books.description: In the field of history, the Web and other technologies have become important tools in research and teaching of the past. 'Pastplay' is a collection of essays written by leading history and humanities researchers and teachers.

books.title: A History of Mourning
books.author: Richard Davey
books.description: Although tradition has not informed us whether our first parents made any change in their garments on the death of their relatives, it is certain that the wearing mourning and the institution of funereal ceremonies are of the most remote antiquity.

books.title: Writing History in the Digital Age
books.author: Kristen Nawrotzki, Jack Dougherty
books.description: With our unique focus on writing, our innovative web-born format and our open review process, we seek to move beyond the traditionalist ways scholars -- and historians in particular -- have tended to think about and to use digital technologies.

books.title: Whose History? Engaging History Students through Historical Fiction
books.author: Grant Rodwell
books.description: This text aims to illustrate how historical novels and their related genres may be used as an engaging learning strategy for student teachers in pre-service teacher education courses. The book examines the traditions in Australian historical fiction.

books.title: Australia Unlimited
books.author: Edwin James Brady
books.description: The body of the material for Australia Unlimited has not been gathered from printed pages, but collected carefully. State by State, mile by mile, year after year, from the wide circle of a continent -- a continent of potentialities still unrealized.

books.title: Great Wars and Great Leaders: A Libertarian Rebuttal
books.author: Ralph Raico
books.description: The great historian of classical liberalism strips away the veneer of exalted leaders and beloved wars. Professor Ralph Raico shows them to be wolves in sheep's clothing and their wars as attacks on human liberty and human rights.

books.title: A Guide to Writing in History and Classics
books.author: Mark Damen
books.description: The medium of history and classics as intellectual disciplines is the written word. Sloppiness of expression is as detrimental to any historical study. This guide is designed to help you avoid some of the pitfalls into which students often fall.

books.title: Nonkilling History: Shaping Policy with Lessons from the Past
books.author: Antony Adolf (ed.)
books.description: The surprise insight from Nonkilling History is that what did not happen explains why humanity lives today. This turns upside down understanding of history as the story of the victory of righteous human violence in struggles to satisfy human needs.

books.title: History of the Incas
books.author: Pedro Sarmiento de Gamboa
books.description: The history of the Incas by Sarmiento is, without any doubt, the most authentic and reliable that has yet appeared. For it was compiled from the carefully attested evidence of the Incas themselves, taken under official sanction.

books.title: The History of the Nineteenth Century in Caricature
books.author: Cooper, Maurice
books.description: While the impulse to satirize public men in picture is probably as old as satiric verse, the political cartoon, as an effective agent in molding public opinion, is essentially a product of modern conditions. Its success depends upon its timeliness.

books.title: Understanding History: An Introduction to Analytical Philosophy of History
books.author: Jonathan Gorman
books.description: Has any question about the historical past ever been finally answered? This incisive study goes one step further and brings into question the very ability of historians to gather and communicate genuine knowledge about the past.

books.title: Mooted Questions of History
books.author: Humphrey J. Desmond
books.description: History perhaps can never become an exact science, the human element inevitably asserts itself to some extent. But if we have more faithfulness to scientific methods of investigation, there are grounds for expecting excellent results in the future.

books.title: Researching and Writing in History
books.author: F. N. McCoy
books.description: In this handbook the author has analyzed the stages involved in the term research paper from the viewpoint of the time involved in each, the order in which they should be undertaken, and their distribution over the typical university quarter.

books.title: The Story of Extinct Civilizations of the West
books.author: Robert Edward Anderson
books.description: Contents: Pre-Columbian Discoveries of America; Extinct Civilization of the Aztecs; American Archeology; Mexico before the Spanish Invasion; Arrival of the Spaniards; Cortes and Montezuma; Balboa and the Isthmus; Extinct Civilization of Peru; etc.

books.title: Introduction to the Study of History
books.author: C. Langlois, C. Seignobos
books.description: This is not a summary of universal history for the use of beginners. The book is intended, not as a summary of ascertained facts or a system of general ideas on universal history, but as an essay on the method of the historical sciences.

books.title: How to Research Local History
books.author: Pamela Brooks
books.description: You don't have to be a trained historian to be interested in and research local history; all you need is an interest, an inquiring mind, an ability to keep your notes in an order where you can retrieve information quickly, and perseverance.

books.title: Communication in the Real World: An Introduction to Communication Studies
books.author: Richard Jones
books.description: The book overviews the time-tested conceptual foundations of the field, while incorporating the latest research and cutting-edge applications of these basics. Each chapter will include real-life examples of communication concepts in action.

books.title: Digital Rhetoric: Theory, Method, Practice
books.author: Douglas Eyman
books.description: What is digital rhetoric? This book aims to answer that question by looking at a number of interrelated histories, as well as evaluating a wide range of methods and practices from fields in the humanities, social sciences, and information sciences...

books.title: Digital Humanities Pedagogy: Practices, Principles and Politics
books.author: Brett Hirsch (ed.)
books.description: The book offers views on the practical realities of teaching digital humanities at undergraduate and graduate levels, presenting case studies of the experiences alongside models for future courses and reflections on pedagogical successes or failures.

books.title: Language in Use: Cognitive and Discourse Perspectives on Language and Language Learning
books.author: Andrea E. Tyler, et al.
books.description: Language in Use creatively brings together, for the first time, perspectives from cognitive linguistics, language acquisition, discourse analysis, and linguistic anthropology. The unifying theme is studying how language is used in context ...

books.title: Interdisciplining Digital Humanities
books.author: Julie Thompson Klein
books.description: The book sorts through definitions and patterns of practice over roughly 65 years of work, providing an overview for specialists and the general audience alike. It depicts the ways this new field is being situated within individual domains ...

books.title: Statistics for the Humanities
books.author: John Canning
books.description: This book is a beginner's guide to statistics which uses examples from the humanities subjects. The book is aimed primarily at undergraduate humanities students, especially those who have not studied mathematics since the age of 16.

books.title: Studies on the Legend of the Holy Grail
books.author: Alfred Nutt
books.description: The present work is a collection of 'Studies.' It does not profess to give an exhaustive or orderly account of the Grail romance cycle; it deals with particular aspects of the legend, and makes no pretence of exhausting even these.

books.title: The Theory of the Theatre
books.author: Clayton Hamilton
books.description: Contents: The New Art of Making Plays. Pictorial Stage. Decorative Drama. The Drama of Illusion. The Modern Art of Stage Direction. A Plea for a New Type of Play. Period of Pragmatism. Undramatic Drama. The Value of Stage Conventions. etc.

books.title: Tracking Changes in the Humanities
books.author: Malcolm Richardson
books.description: Critics of the contemporary university have argued that the humanities are losing ground inside America's colleges and universities. Verifying if this is true requires reliable and measurable data about such topics as trends in university financing.

books.title: A Companion to Digital Humanities
books.author: Susan Schreibman, Ray Siemens, John Unsworth
books.description: A complete yet concise overview of this emerging discipline. The book addresses the central concerns of those interested in the subject. The articles are grouped into topical sections focusing on the experience of particular disciplines.

books.title: Tertium Organum
books.author: P.D. Ouspensky
books.description: The mystery of space and time. Shadows and reality. Occultism and love. Animated nature. Voices of the stones. Mathematics of the infinite. The logic of ecstasy. Mystical theosophy. Cosmic consciousness. The New Morality. Birth of the superman.

books.title: Torts: Cases, Principles, and Institutions
books.author: John Fabian Witt, Karen Tani
books.description: A casebook for a one-semester torts course that carves out a distinctive niche in the field by focusing on the institutions and sociology of American tort law. The book retains familiar features of the traditional casebook, including classic cases.

books.title: Basics of Product Liability, Sales, and Contracts
books.author: D. Mayer, D. Warner, G. Siedel, J. Lieberman
books.description: This textbook provides context and essential concepts across the entire range of legal issues with which managers and business executives must grapple. The text provides the vocabulary and legal acumen necessary for businesspeople ...

books.title: Kiss of Death: America's Love Affair with the Death Penalty
books.author: John D. Bessler
books.description: Bessler interweaves the powerful life stories of death row prisoners, his own experiences as a pro-bono attorney on death penalty cases, and historical perspective to persuade the reader that state-sanctioned executions must be abolished in the US.

books.title: Law for Entrepreneurs
books.author: D. Warner, G. Siedel, J. Lieberman
books.description: This textbook provides context and essential concepts across the entire range of legal issues with which managers and business executives must grapple. The text provides the vocabulary and legal acumen necessary for businesspeople ...

books.title: Environmental Protection and Transitions from Conflict to Peace
books.author: C. Stahn, J. Iverson, J. S. Easterday (eds)
books.description: This book is the first work in the legal literature that investigates environmental challenges in the aftermath of conflict. The volume clarifies policies of environmental protection and key legal considerations related to normative frameworks ...

books.title: America Without the Death Penalty
books.author: John F. Galliher, et al.
books.description: As the struggle over capital punishment rages on, twelve states have taken bold measures to eliminate the practice. This landmark study is the first to examine the history and motivations of those jurisdictions that abolished capital punishment.

books.title: Virtual Justice: The New Laws Of Online Worlds
books.author: Greg Lastowka
books.description: Greg Lastowka illustrates the real legal dilemmas posed by virtual worlds. He explains how governments are responding to the chaos in the cyberspace. He explores how laws of property, jurisdiction, crime, and copyright, pave the path of virtual law.

books.title: The Indigo Book: A Manual of Legal Citation
books.author: Christopher Sprigman
books.description: The Indigo Book covers legal citation for U.S. legal materials, as well as books, periodicals, Internet, etc. An open and compatible implementation of the Uniform System of Citation for legal research, this volume is in the public domain.

books.title: Electronic Signatures in Law
books.author: Stephen Mason
books.description: This fourth edition of the well-established practitioner text sets out what constitutes an electronic signature; the form an electronic signature can take; and discusses the issues relating to evidence - illustrated by analysis of relevant case ...

books.title: How to Do Animal Rights: ...legally with confidence
books.author: Ben Isacat
books.description: Do animal rights as a practical and legal activity. Topics include: major problems that humanity is causing animal life; moral philosophy underlying animal rights; major methods of campaigning, practical activities for promoting animal rights; etc.

books.title: Manifest Madness: Mental Incapacity in the Criminal Law
books.author: Arlie Loughnan
books.description: Understanding the terrain of mental incapacity in criminal law is notoriously difficult; it involves tracing overlapping and interlocking legal doctrines, current and past practices. This book provides a close study of mental incapacity defences.

books.title: Legal Literacy: An Introduction to Legal Studies
books.author: Archie Zariski
books.description: To understand how the legal system works, students must become literate in the field. The book fulfills this aim by providing the key concepts such as legal personhood, jurisdiction, and precedent, and by introducing students to legal research.

books.title: Body Law and the Body of Law
books.author: Christine M. Hassenstab
books.description: The book examines how laws on sterilization, birth control and abortion were created, by focusing on the act of legislation; how the law was driven by scientific and social norms during the first and closing decades of the 20th century in the USA ...

books.title: Criminal Law
books.author: Lisa Storm
books.description: 'Criminal Law' begins with the foundations of law and the legal system and then extensively explores criminal laws and defenses using general state principles, federal law, the Constitution, and the Model Penal Code as guidelines.

books.title: Basic Income Tax
books.author: William Kratzke
books.description: This book is the third edition of a basic income tax text, revised for the 2015-2016 academic year. It is intended to be a readable text, suitable for a three-hour course for a class comprised of law students with widely different backgrounds.

books.title: First Amendment: Cases, Controversies, and Contexts
books.author: Ruthann Robson
books.description: This Casebook is intended to be used in an upper-division course covering the First Amendment to the United States Constitution. The Casebook is organized with the Speech Clauses as Part One and the Religion Clauses as Part Two.

books.title: Sources of American Law: An Introduction to Legal Research
books.author: Beau Steenken, Tina M. Brooks
books.description: This text introduces first-year law students to the new kind of research required to study and to practice law. It seeks to demystify the art of legal research by following a 'Source and Process' approach. The book focuses mainly on the basics.

books.title: The Legal and Ethical Environment of Business
books.author: Terence Lau, Lisa Johnson
books.description: For students who expect learning to be comprised not only of substance, but also of interactive exercises and multimedia. It streamlines the presentation of material to ensure that every page is relevant, engaging, and interesting to undergraduates.

books.title: Goverment Regulation and the Legal Environment of Business
books.author: Don Mayer, et al.
books.description: Up-to-date textbook that covers legal issues that students must understand in today's business environment. It covers contracts, consumer credit transactions, bankruptcy, intellectual property, securities regulation, regulation of real estate, etc.

books.title: Advanced Business Law and the Legal Environment
books.author: Don Mayer, et al.
books.description: The book provides students with context and essential legal concepts relating to the Uniform Commercial Code and various aspects of property law. Appropriate for students who have already taken introductory Legal Environment or Business Law course.

books.title: The Sovereignty of Law: The European Way
books.author: Cambridge University Press
books.description: With the non-specialist in mind, and starting from the basic notion of the rule of law, this book explores how judges can balance the potentially conflicting interests of human life and human dignity; freedom of speech and the right of privacy ...

books.title: Introduction to the American Legal System
books.author: Konnie G. Kustron
books.description: An overview of the legal system in the United States. It is designed for learners who have little familiarity with U.S. law. Topics include federal and state court systems, civil and criminal litigation processes, and ethics in the legal profession.

books.title: Commercial Law in the Next Millennium
books.author: Royston Miles Goode
books.description: In this book, Roy Goode examines some of the key issues shaping commercial law as we move into a new century. His stimulating re-analysis of fundamental legal principles raises a series of critical questions about the future direction of the law.

books.title: Turning Points of the Common Law
books.author: Robin Brunskill Cooke
books.description: Cooke focuses on four great cases which were all turning points in the development of the common law. In each instance he examines the effect at the time, subsequent developments in case law and academic opinion, and the advantages of decisions...

books.title: Justification and Excuse in the Criminal Law
books.author: J. C. Smith
books.description: Smith considers a subject of great importance to the criminal law, both as an academic topic and in the context of the problems faced by the citizen confronted with a choice between breaking the letter of the law, or seeing others suffer harm.

books.title: Basic Home Security
books.author: Jacobus Kotze
books.description: This is a short article on the different ways to protect your house against armed robbers. Written for the South African market it may sound extreme to the rest of the world but gives valuable guidance which is applicable everywhere.

books.title: A Manufacturer's Guide To Product Liability Law in the United States
books.author: Perkins Coie
books.description: This primer provides basic information about product liability laws and legal procedures in product liability lawsuits in the United States. It also suggests measures that you can take to reduce your product liability exposure.

books.title: Law and Lawyers in the United States: The Common Law Under Stress
books.author: Erwin N. Griswold
books.description: This book may serve to help you to have a better understanding of our legal system and its many problems; and it may, too, lead to the conclusion that you are indeed privileged to live under your own constitutional and legal system.

books.title: Your Worst Enemy
books.author: Jacobus Kotze
books.description: This book is about the way defaulters are treated by their bank once they fall on hard times and cannot pay the instalment anymore. There are many legal rights which offer protection against abuse and this book explains them all in clear English.

books.title: How to Handle Tough Choices in Your Legal Career and Be Successful
books.author: A. Harrison Barnes
books.description: BCG Attorney Search's Recruiters answer commonly asked questions about the legal field. Most of these are questions relating to making a lateral move, work-life balance, interview tips, careers moves for recent graduates and other common questions.

books.title: Business Law and the Legal Environment
books.author: D. Mayer, D. Warner, G. Siedel, J.K. Lieberman
books.description: This text is an up-to-date textbook with comprehensive coverage of legal and regulatory issues. The authors take special care to engage students by relating law to everyday events with which they are already familiar with their clear style.

books.title: The Art of Cross-Examination
books.author: Francis L. Wellman
books.description: I have not attempted to treat the subject in any scientific, elaborate, or exhaustive way; but merely to make some suggestions upon the art of cross-examination, which have been gathered as a result of twenty-five years' court practice.

books.title: Media Law Handbook
books.author: Jane Kirtley
books.description: What are the privileges and responsibilities of a free press? In Media Law Handbook, Professor Jane Kirtley, Silha Professor of Media Ethics and Law at the University of Minnesota, explores how free societies answer this question.

books.title: Outline of U.S. Legal System
books.author: George Clack
books.description: This Outline covers the history and organization of the federal and state judicial systems; the criminal and civil court processes; the qualifications and selection of federal judges; the role of other participants in the judicial process.

books.title: Marriage and Divorce Laws of the World
books.author: Hyacinthe Ringrose
books.description: The purpose of this volume is to furnish to the lawyer, legislator and student a working summary of the marriage and divorce laws of the principal countries of the world. Our endeavour is simply to set forth positive law as it exists today.

books.title: Evidence, Proof and Justice: Legal Philosophy and the Provable in English Courts
books.author: Solomon E. Salako
books.description: It is the object of this book to use legal philosophy to analyse the transformation of the rules of evidence in English courts with a view to teasing out the benefits and portents of the transformation and proffering suggestions for reform.

books.title: Techniques for Teaching Law
books.author: Gerald F. Hess, Steven Friedland
books.description: The book addresses a broad range of pedagogical issues in the context of legal education: the teaching and learning environment, course and class planning, questioning and discussion techniques, visual tools, experiential learning, computers, etc.

books.title: Curious Punishments of Bygone Days
books.author: Alice Morse Earle
books.description: An accumulation of notes on old-time laws, punishments and penalties. The subject is not a pleasant one, though it often has a humorous element; but a punishment that is obsolete gains an interest and dignity from antiquity.

books.title: Courts and Criminals
books.author: Arthur Train
books.description: It is unquestionably a generally accepted principle that it is better that ninety-nine guilty men should escape than that one innocent man should be convicted. This book presents a guide to procedures and practices in criminal courts.

books.title: Simple Justice
books.author: Charles Murray
books.description: The celebrated American sociologist Charles Murray provides an uncompromising restatement and defence of the backward-looking, retributive justification of criminal punishment. He also makes an impassioned plea for England to revert to this approach.

books.title: A Country I Do Not Recognize: The Legal Assault On American Values
books.author: Robert H. Bork
books.description: During the past forty years, activists have used the court system to accomplish results that could not otherwise be obtained through the ordinary political processes. The authors show how legal decisions undermined America's sovereignty and values.

books.title: Punishment: Theory and Practice
books.author: Mark Tunick
books.description: What actions should be punished? Should plea-bargaining be allowed? How should sentencing be determined? In this original, penetrating study, Mark Tunick explores not only why society punishes wrongdoing, but also how it implements punishment.

books.title: Lawyers in Society: An Overview
books.author: R. L. Abel, P. S. C. Lewis
books.description: A concise comparative introduction to the practice of law in a number of countries: England, Germany, Japan, Venezuela, and Belgium. These essays guide readers through the differing worlds of civil and common law, and law in Europe and Asia.

books.title: Law for Computing Students
books.author: Geoffrey Richard Sampson
books.description: This free textbook shows the reader where in the IT-based business legal problems are likely to arise. The author aims to give computing students that kind of broad level of understanding of the law applicable to IT sector.

books.title: Encyclopedia of Law and Economics
books.author: Boudewijn Bouckaert, Gerrit De Geest
books.description: A reference work that surveys the entire literature on law and economics in over 3,000 pages. The entries consist a review of the literature and a bibliography which covers most of the published material in the particular area.

books.title: A Handbook of Greek Constitutional History
books.author: A.H.J. Greenidge
books.description: Lucid and highly readable overview of a difficult and little understood aspect of Greek history: its public law, not just how it was structured but how it behaved in action. Perfect for university students and amateur historians.

books.title: A Short Biographical Dictionary of English Literature
books.author: John W. Cousin
books.description: This book contains the biographical descriptions of 1,678 writers in English Literature organized in the alphabetical order of writers' names. It includes the summary of each writer's works, their life, their characters and circumstances, etc.

books.title: The American Literature Scholar in the Digital Age
books.author: Amy E. Earhart, Andrew Jewell
books.description: The book for those interested in tool development, editing and textual scholarship, digital librarianship, and issues of race and ethnicity in digital humanities, while situating digital humanities work within the larger literary discipline.

books.title: Gleanings in Graveyards
books.author: Horatio Edward Norfolk
books.description: Although this country may be behind many others in the character of its monumental inscriptions, it is certainly not so in the production of Epitaphs of a curious and absurd character. This collection of curious Epitaphs may afford amusement to all.

books.title: Books Condemned to be Burnt
books.author: James Anson Farrer
books.description: When did books first come to be burnt in England, and what was the last book to be so treated? This is the sort of question that occurs to a rational curiosity, but it is this sort of question to which it is often most difficult to find an answer.

books.title: Literary Taste: How to Form It
books.author: Arnold Bennett
books.description: Detailed instructions for collecting a complete library of English literature. Literature is first and last a means of life, and the enterprise of forming one's literary taste is an enterprise of learning how best to use this means of life.

books.title: Some Fundamental Theorems in Mathematics
books.author: Oliver Knill
books.description: An expository guide to some theorems in mathematics. Criteria for the current list of 135 theorems are whether the result can be formulated elegantly, whether it is beautiful or useful and whether it could serve as a guide without leading to panic.

books.title: Tunneling Through the Math Barrier
books.author: William J. Meese
books.description: My goal with the book is to provide some kind of bridge for mathematics between the high-school-level and college-level for physics students. My focus is to help modify your thinking of how math is used, rather than just pummel you with algorithms...

books.title: Mathematics for the Practical Man
books.author: George Howe
books.description: Mathematics, from algebra through calculus, has been treated in such a manner as to be clear to anyone. Men who wish to study a part of mathematics which they have not hitherto had will find this manual just the book for which they have been looking.

books.title: Mathematics for the Physical Sciences
books.author: Leslie Copley
books.description: A text on advanced mathematical methods with numerous applications. The book begins with a thorough introduction to complex analysis, which is then used to understand the properties of ordinary differential equations and their solutions.

books.title: A Primer of Mathematical Writing
books.author: Steven G. Krantz
books.description: This is a tract on the art and practice of mathematical writing. Not only does the book cover basic principles of grammar, syntax, and usage, but it takes into account developments of the last twenty years that have been inspired by the Internet.

books.title: Advanced Problems in Mathematics: Preparing for University
books.author: Stephen Siklos
books.description: The book is intended to help candidates prepare for entrance examinations in mathematics and scientific subjects. It is a must read for any student wishing to apply to scientific subjects at university level and for anybody interested in mathematics.

books.title: Six Septembers: Mathematics for the Humanist
books.author: Patrick Juola, Stephen Ramsay
books.description: Scholars of all stripes are turning their attention to materials that represent enormous opportunities for the future of humanistic inquiry. The purpose of the book is to impart the concepts that underlie the mathematics they are likely to encounter.

books.title: Mathematics Illuminated
books.author: MacGregor Campbell
books.description: Mathematics Illuminated is a text for adult learners and high school teachers. It explores major themes of mathematics, from humankind's earliest study of prime numbers, to the cutting-edge mathematics used to reveal the shape of the universe.

books.title: Galois Lectures
books.author: J. Douglas, P. Franklin, C.J. Keyser, L. Infeld
books.description: Addresses delivered by Jesse Douglas, Philip Franklin, Cassius Jackson Keyser, and Leopold Infeld. Contents: Survey of the theory of integration; The four color problem; Charles Sanders Peirce as a pioneer; The fourth dimension and relativity.

books.title: H2 Mathematics Textbook
books.author: Yan Min Choo
books.description: Includes 300 exercises and all 2006-2015 A-level exam questions -- all worked solutions included. Brief contents: I. Functions and Graphs. II. Sequences and Series. III. Vectors IV. Complex Numbers. V. Calculus. VI. Probability and Statistics.

books.title: An Infinitely Large Napkin
books.author: Evan Chen
books.description: The book is aimed at making higher math accessible to high school students. Topics: Basic Algebra and Topology; Linear Algebra; Multivariable Calculus; Groups and Rings; Complex Analysis; Quantum Algorithms; Algebraic Topology; Category Theory; etc.

books.title: Basic Math Quick Reference Handbook
books.author: Peter J. Mitas
books.description: This handbook, written by an experienced math teacher, lets readers quickly look up definitions, facts, and problem solving steps. It includes over 700 detailed examples and tips to help them improve their mathematical problem solving skills.

books.title: An Introduction to Contemporary Mathematics
books.author: John Hutchinson
books.description: The goal is to introduce you to contemporary mainstream 20th and 21st century mathematics. If you are doing this course you will have a strong interest in mathematics, and probably be in the top 5% or so of students academically.

books.title: Problems with and Without ... Problems!
books.author: Florentin Smarandache
books.description: This book is addressed to College honor students, researchers, and professors. It contains 136 original problems published by the author in various journals. The problems could be used to preparing for courses, exams, and Olympiads in mathematics.

books.title: Advanced High-School Mathematics
books.author: David B. Surowski
books.description: An advanced mathematics textbook accessible by and interesting to a relatively advanced high-school student. Topics: geometry, discrete mathematics, abstract algebra, series and ordinary differential equations, and inferential statistics.

books.title: Mathematics for Technical Schools
books.author: J.M. Warren, W.H. Rutherford
books.description: In this book an attempt has been made to present the subject of Elementary Mathematics in a way suitable to industrial students in our technical schools. The fundamentals as herein presented will form a basis for a wide range of industries.

books.title: Higher Mathematics for Students of Chemistry and Physics
books.author: Joseph William Mellor
books.description: Long a standard textbook for graduate use in both Britain and America, this 1902 classic of modern mathematics remains a lucid, if advanced introduction to higher mathematics as used in advanced chemistry and physics courses.

books.title: Mathematical Formula Handbook
books.author: Wu-ting Tsai
books.description: Contents: Series; Vector Algebra; Matrix Algebra; Vector Calculus; Complex Variables; Trigonometry; Hyperbolic Functions; Limits; Differentiation; Integration; Differential Equations; Calculus of Variations; Functions of Several Variables; etc.

books.title: Handbook of Engineering Mathematics
books.author: Walter E. Wynne, William Spraragen
books.description: The authors endeavored to supply a handy means of reference to theoretical and applied mathematics used in engineering, and while the first aim has been to make this a mathematical handbook, it also includes the underlying engineering applications.

books.title: Engineering Mathematics: YouTube Workbook
books.author: Christopher C. Tisdell
books.description: This textbook takes learning to a new level by combining free written lessons with free online video tutorials. Each section within the workbook is linked to a video lesson on YouTube where the author discusses and solves problems step-by-step.

books.title: Math in Society
books.author: David Lippman
books.description: A survey of math for liberal arts majors. Introduces contemporary mathematics topics: voting theory, weighted voting, fair division, graph theory, scheduling, growth models, finance math, statistics, and historical counting systems.

books.title: Encyclopaedia of Mathematics
books.author: Michiel Hazewinkel
books.description: The Online Encyclopaedia of Mathematics is the most up-to-date and comprehensive English-language graduate-level reference work in the field of mathematics. It comprises more than 8,000 entries and illuminates nearly 50,000 notions in mathematics.

books.title: Mathematical Methods for Physical Sciences II
books.author: Christoph Kirsch
books.description: Topics covered: Introduction to boundary value problems for the diffusion, Laplace and wave partial differential equations; Bessel functions and Legendre functions; Introduction to complex variables including the calculus of residues.

books.title: Essential Engineering Mathematics
books.author: Michael Batty
books.description: The aim is to explain some areas commonly found difficult, such as calculus, and to ease the transition from school level to university level mathematics, where sometimes the subject matter is similar, but the emphasis is usually different.

books.title: Engineering Mathematics with Tables
books.author: M.A. Keasey, G.A. Kline, D.A. McIlhatten
books.description: The problems in this book emphasize the use of the mathematical principles so vital to a clear understanding of Engineering. They also furnish the necessary foundation for the later development of the Analytical Geometry and the Calculus.

books.title: The Millennium Prize Problems
books.author: J. Carlson, A. Jaffe, A. Wiles
books.description: Guided by the premise that solving the most important mathematical problems will advance the field, this book offers a fascinating look at the seven unsolved Millennium Prize problems. This work describes these problems at the professional level.

books.title: Just the Maths
books.author: A. J. Hobson
books.description: Just the Maths is a collection of separate units intended to service foundation level and first year degree level courses in higher education. It concentrates on the core mathematical techniques required by any scientist or engineer.

books.title: Higher Mathematics for Engineers and Physicists
books.author: Ivan S. Sokolnikoff
books.description: The chief purpose of the book is to help to bridge the gap which separates many engineers from mathematics by giving them a bird's-eye view of those mathematical topics which are indispensable in the study of the physical sciences.

books.title: Mathematics for Engineers
books.author: William Neville Rose
books.description: These two volumes form a most comprehensive and practical treatise on the subject. They show the direct bearing of all principles to engineering practice, and will prove a valuable reference work embracing all the mathematics needed by engineers.

books.title: Unfolding the Labyrinth: Open Problems in Mathematics, Physics, Astrophysics
books.author: Florentin Smarandache, at al.
books.description: Throughout this book, the authors discuss some open problems in various branches of science, including mathematics, theoretical physics, astrophysics, geophysics, etc. Some parts of these problems may be found useful for scholarly stimulation.

books.title: Basics of Algebra and Analysis For Computer Science
books.author: Jean Gallier
books.description: From the table of contents: Linear Algebra; Determinants; Basics of Affine Geometry; Polynomials, PID's and UFD's; Topology; Differential Calculus; Zorn’s Lemma and Some Applications; Gaussian elimination, LU-factoring and Cholesky-factoring.

books.title: Mathematics for the Physical Sciences
books.author: Herbert S Wilf
books.description: The book for the advanced undergraduates and graduates in the natural sciences. Vector spaces and matrices, orthogonal functions, polynomial equations, asymptotic expansions, ordinary differential equations, conformal mapping, and extremum problems.

books.title: Pathological Bodies: Medicine and Political Culture
books.author: Corinna Wagner
books.description: This book explores the connections between medicine and political culture that often have been overlooked. In response to the French revolution, political propagandists adopted a scientific vocabulary and medical images for their own purposes.

books.title: Innovative Medicine: Basic Research and Development
books.author: Kazuwa Nakao, Nagahiro Minato, Shinji Uemoto
books.description: This book helps to understand innovative medicine and to make progress in its realization. The book covers 1) basic research for innovative medicine, 2) translational research for innovative medicine, and 3) new technology for innovative medicine.

books.title: Emerging Technologies to Promote and Evaluate Physical Activity
books.author: Dan J Graham, et al.
books.description: Increasingly, efforts to promote and measure physical activity are achieving greater precision by incorporating emerging technologies. More precise measurement will enable more effective targeting of particular behavior settings.

books.title: Treatise of Implant Dentistry
books.author: Ugo Pasqualini, Marco E Pasqualini
books.description: This book has been written to do justice to all those who contributed to the evolution of implant dentistry, from its origins to the present day. We will provide useful information, also offering opinions, reservations and recommendations.

books.title: Fitness Medicine
books.author: Hasan Sozen (ed.)
books.description: Although fitness and health have similar properties, they are two very different concepts. While health refers to the absence of diseases, fitness refers to the degree of body functioning and the ability of the body to handle physical demands.

books.title: The Edinburgh Companion to the Critical Medical Humanities
books.author: Sarah Atkinson, Jane Macnaughton, Jennifer Richards
books.description: This volume comprehensively introduces the ways in which interdisciplinary thinking across the humanities and social sciences might contribute to, critique and develop medical understanding of the human individually and collectively.

books.title: Health Effects of Electromagnetism
books.author: Paul Heroux
books.description: From the table of contents: Electric Power Systems - Description of Electric Power Networks; Electrical Safety; Electromagnetism and Biology; Health Effects of Extra-Low Frequency Radiation; Health Effects of Radio-Frequencies and Microwaves.

books.title: The Making of British Bioethics
books.author: Duncan Wilson
books.description: This book draws on a wide range of sources to detail how and why bioethics became so influential in Britain, including the archives of government departments, public inquiries, universities and professional organisations, as well as private papers.

books.title: Telemedicine
books.author: Ramesh Madhavan, Shahram Khalid (eds)
books.description: Telemedicine is the use of telecommunication and information technologies in order to provide clinical health care at a distance. This volume is related to Mental health, Internal Medicine, Ophthalmology, and telemedicine delivery platforms.

books.title: GNU Health
books.author: Luis Falcón
books.description: This book is about GNU Health, the Free Health and Hospital information System. GNU Health is a philosophy. It's putting Free Software as a public good, and as an integral part of Public Health. It's about equity, community work and solidarity.

books.title: Treatments for Seasonal Allergic Rhinitis
books.author: Joan Glacy et al.
books.description: This review compared the effectiveness and common adverse events of medication classes used to treat seasonal allergic rhinitis in adolescents and adults, and in children. Two independent reviewers performed study selection and data abstraction.

books.title: Regenerative Medicine and Tissue Engineering
books.author: Jose A. Andrades (ed.)
books.description: The book covers stem cells, cell culture, polymer synthesis, novel biomaterials, drug delivery, therapeutics, and the creation of tissues and organs. It will serve as a reference for graduate students, post-docs, teachers, and physicians.

books.title: Sexology
books.author: Vladimir Antonov
books.description: This book contains a description of mechanisms and regularities of the development of the reproduction system of human beings, including embryonic period, childhood and adolescence. It also describes the mechanisms of forming of homosexuality.

books.title: Men's Business A to Z
books.author: Warwick Carter
books.description: This book is a simple guide to the genital and urinary systems of men their anatomy, symptoms, investigation, diseases, management, function and physiology. Despite its size it is comprehensive and includes all relevant information for the topic.

books.title: Human Dignity and Bioethics
books.author: Adam Schulman, Thomas W. Merrill
books.description: Human dignity -- is it a useful concept in bioethics, one that sheds important light on the whole range of bioethical issues, from embryo research and assisted reproduction, to biomedical enhancement, to care of the disabled and the dying?

books.title: Otolaryngology
books.author: Balwant Singh Gendeh
books.description: This book incorporates new developments, as well as future perspectives in otolaryngology. Otolaryngologists, researches, specialists, trainees, and general practitioners with interest in otolaryngology will find the book interesting and useful.

books.title: When I'm 64
books.author: L.L. Carstensen, C.R. Hartel
books.description: Examines how individual and social behavior play a role in understanding diverse outcomes in old age. It also explores the implications of an aging workforce on the economy. A useful resource for policymakers, researchers and medical professionals.

books.title: Tracheal Stenosis: Diagnosis and Treatment
books.author: Badr E. Mostafa et al.
books.description: The determination of the extent of stenosis and any associated pathological lesions is critical in the design of a proper treatment. The aim of this guide is to compile a working protocol for the diagnosis and management of these complex cases.

books.title: No More Aching Back
books.author: Leon Root
books.description: Dr. Root explains how a back examination is conducted and what tests a doctor performs to determine the cause of your back pain. He describes the structure of the back, how it functions, and how these functions can break down in an unhealthy back.

books.title: Finger Prints
books.author: Sir Francis Galton
books.description: The book discusses the evidence validating fingerprints as a means of personal identification, permanence of the fingerprint characteristics, uniqueness of an assemblage of ridge details, the variability and classifiable nature of patterns, etc.

books.title: Embryonic Stem Cells
books.author: Craig Atwood
books.description: Pluripotent stem cells have the potential to revolutionize medicine, providing treatment for diseases that currently lack therapies. This book describes recent advances in the generation of tissue specific cell types for regenerative applications.

books.title: GP Notebook
books.author: James McMorran, at al.
books.description: GPnotebook is an online encyclopaedia of medicine that provides a trusted immediate reference resource for clinicians in the UK and internationally. Fast and reliable, many doctors use GPnotebook during the consultation.

books.title: Degeneracy: Its Causes, Signs and Results
books.author: Eugene S. Talbot
books.description: The present work is the result of twenty years' labour in a limited medical department of biology. It attempts to lay down general principles for practical purposes in a way that permits their application to the solution of sociologic problems.

books.title: Anomalies and Curiosities of Medicine
books.author: George M. Gould, Walter L. Pyle
books.description: A book written in 1896, cataloging the true and the apocryphal from medical literature going as far back as ancient Rome. Some of this stuff is very definitely false, some is definitely true; and most of the stuff in between is hard to believe.

books.title: The People's Common Sense Medical Adviser in Plain English
books.author: R.V. Pierce
books.description: An extensive dissertation on Physiology, Hygiene, Temperaments, Diseases and Domestic Remedies. It is for the welfare of every person to understand the means for the preservation of health. This edition was published in 1895.

books.title: Working the Phones
books.author: Jamie Woodcock
books.description: Woodcock worked undercover in a call centre to gather insights into the experiences of call centre workers. He shows how this work has become emblematic of the shift towards a post-industrial service economy, and all the issues that this produces.

books.title: Reading Today
books.author: Heta Pyrhönen, Janna Kantola
books.description: This book places reading in current literary and cultural contexts in order to analyse how these contexts challenge our conceptions of who reads, what reading is, how we read, where we read, and for what purposes - and then responds to the questions.

books.title: The Night the Mountain Fell: The Story of the Montana-Yellowstone Earthquake
books.author: Edmund Christopherson
books.description: The book is a riveting account of the deadly 7.5 earthquake that struck Yellowstone Park in 1959. Also known as the Yellowstone Earthquake, the disaster caused massive flooding and the worst landslide in the history of the Northwestern United States.

books.title: Perception of Beauty
books.author: Martha Peaslee Levine (ed.)
books.description: The authors ask us to consider whether the perception of beauty has been defined by our genetics and culture over the years. Has it grown and changed? Can we divorce ourselves from dictates and sink into a mindful connection with our internal beauty?

books.title: Lying for Fun and Profit: The Truth about the Media
books.author: Kurt Butler
books.description: Exposes the corrupt symbiosis between the corporate mass media and New Age health fraud industries. How the dishonest media have indoctrinated an entire generation into mistrusting science, and believing nonsense and lies about health and medicine.

books.title: Lightships and Lighthouses
books.author: Frederick A. Talbot
books.description: This volume is not a history of lightships and lighthouses; neither is it a technical treatise. Rather my object has been to relate how the difficulties have been overcome by the builders in their efforts to mark some terrible danger-spots ...

books.title: Oops! The 9 Ways We Screw Up Our Toddlers
books.author: Michelle Smith
books.description: Becoming a parent is a scary thing. Even more scary when we see how some of the kids around us act. Oops! takes you through the top nine reasons that kids act rotten. It teaches you what to avoid and how to raise a happy, well-adjusted little person.

books.title: ABC of Vegetable Gardening
books.author: Eben E. Rexford
books.description: Anyone who owns a bit of land, and has some time that can be given to garden-work, and an inclination to do so, can make a gardener of himself in a season if he allows himself to be governed by the advice of someone who has had some experience ...

books.title: Volleyball Essentials
books.author: Marv Dunphy
